intro: Adicea stelluligera, commonly known as the starry stelluligera, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, delicate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its most distinctive feature is its clusters of tiny, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Adicea stelluligera is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
